info.title: Dayton Freight API
info.description:
# Getting Started

Edit this content by editing the the file /Docs/overview.md

---

## Authentication

get.description: Gets service center information for all Dayton Freight service centers.
Gets service center information for a single Dayton Freight service center.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The three character Dayton Freight service center id.

get.description: Gets all the Dayton Freight accepted shipping classes.
Gets a list of Dayton Freight acceptable packaging types.
Edit this content by editing the the file /Docs/operations/GET_v1_accounts.md

Retrieves Dayton Freight image data from the Document Imaging System based on results from the Images/Search endpoint.
This endpoint is dependent on data returned from the Images/Search endpoint. The type and hash parameters for this endpoint are returned in the Images/Search endpoint. Please call that endpoint first.

parameters.name: pro
parameters.description: Dayton Freight PRO number.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The document type for this specified PRO number. This value must first be retrieved by using the Images/Search endpoint.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash code retrieved from the Images/Search endpoint for the specified Document Type for the requested PRO number.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The image format requested for the image response data. Specifying a format not in the list or not specifying a format defaults to a tif.

get.description: Searches for document images by a given Dayton Freight PRO number.

parameters.name: pro
parameters.description: Dayton Freight PRO number.

get.description: Gets all service holidays in a date range.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date.

get.description: Gets active service alerts.
Returns service eligibility and transit time information for a specified origin and destination zip code.

parameters.name: originZip
parameters.description: Origin postal code. It is 5-digit for the United States, 5-digit for Mexico, or 6-character alternating letters and digits (w/o space/hyphen in between 3rd and 4th characters) for Canada

parameters.name: destinationZip
parameters.description: Destination postal code. It is 5-digit for the United States, 5-digit for Mexico, or 6-character alternating letters and digits (w/o space/hyphen in between 3rd and 4th characters) for Canada

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

post.description: Creates a new bill of lading with Dayton Freight based on the standards of the LTL Digital Council.

put.description: Updates an existing bill of lading with Dayton Freight based on the standards of the LTL Digital Council.

get.description: Gets the tracking history for a shipment.

parameters.name: proNumber
parameters.description: The PRO number.

get.description:
Tracks shipments using a parameter-value list of numbers.The type of number is specified by the type parameter.

Tracking by a pickup shipment id (PSID) will only return results once the shipments have been assigned PRO numbers and scanned by a Dayton Freight driver.
Tracks Dayton Freight shipments using a date range and Dayton Freight account number. The date range for all requests are limited to 31 days.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start date of the date range to search for shipments

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end date of the date range to search for shipments

parameters.name: customer
parameters.description: The account code for the shipments returned.

get.description: Tracks pending shipments using a Dayton Freight account number. Pending shipments are shipments that have not been delivered within the last 30 days.

post.description:
Creates a pickup request. Integration with this endpoint can be tested by setting the isTest property to true. By sending the value true for isTest a pickup will NOT be created in the Dayton Freight pickup system and the fake pickup number XXX-1234 will be returned. Creating a pickup generates a "Pickup Number" (e.g. DAY-123456) that encompasses all of the shipments contained within the pickup request. Each shipment (sometimes referred to as an item or line item) within the pickup is given a unique identifier called the "Pickup Shipment ID", abbreviated as "PSID". Both the Pickup Number or a shipment's PSID can be used to track the progress of the pickup on the TrackByNumbers endpoint.
Pickup Requirements and Restrictions
Times should be in shipperâ€™s local time without a time zone indicator in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss
The Ready datetime cannot be prior to the current local date and time.
The Ready datetime cannot be after 5:00pm local time.
The Ready datetime must be at least 2 hours before the provided Close datetime.
Pickups cannot be scheduled on holidays or weekends.
The Ready datetime must be within 45 days of the current date.
A minimum of 1 shipment must be specified.
Handling units on a shipment is required and must be an integer between 1 and 999 units.
Weight on a shipment is required and must be an integer between 1 and 40,000 pounds.
Comments, CustomerReferenceNumber, and PickupInstructions are concatenated in our pickup system and the total length of all 3 properties must be less than 230 characters.
Accessorials with Service Restrictions
Pickup Services
NOTAppointment Needed or Call Before
RESIPResidential Pickup
Delivery Services
AIRDELAirport
NOTAppointment Needed or Call Before
CCVDChicago Trade Show, Exhibition Hall
LIFTLiftgate Trailer for Delivery
RESIDResidential Delivery
CVDTrade Show
LIMITLimited Access (church, school, restaurant, etc.)
Shipment Characteristics
EXLG07 - EXLG20Overlength Freight 7-20 Feet

put.description: Updates the specified pickup based on Dayton Freight pickup number.

parameters.name: pickupId
parameters.description: The Dayton Freight pickup number (e.g. DAY-123456).

parameters.name: pickupId
parameters.description: The Dayton Freight pickup number (e.g. DAY-123456).

get.description: Gets an existing Pickup Request.

parameters.name: lookupValue
parameters.description: The value to look up

parameters.name: lookupType
parameters.description: The type of value to look up

parameters.name: requestType
parameters.description: The type of request to make

parameters.name: isTest
parameters.description: Indicates whether the submitted request is intended to be a test

get.description: Gets the rate estimate details by rate estimate id.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The quote number of the rate estimate to get.

get.description: Gets an account entity by Id.
Gets a location entity by Id.
Gets a shipment entity by PRO.
Gets a shipment entity by PRO.

codes.description: List of services requested for the shipment.

AccessorialsModel.description: Specifies accessorials codes and accompanying data.

postalCode.description: Postal code. It is 5-digit for the United States, 5-digit for Mexico, or 6-character alternating letters and digits (w/o space/hyphen in between 3rd and 4th characters) for Canada
Postal code. It is 5-digit for the United States, 5-digit for Mexico, or 6-character alternating letters and digits (w/o space/hyphen in between 3rd and 4th characters) for Canada

contact.description: Contact details. Bill To, Remit To, Customs Broker, Origin, Destination.

postalCode.description: Postal code. It is 5-digit for the United States, 5-digit for Mexico, or 6-character alternating letters and digits (w/o space/hyphen in between 3rd and 4th characters) for Canada

contact.description: Contact details. Bill To, Remit To, Customs Broker, Origin, Destination.

AccountRateThresholds.description: Defines the maximum thresholds for rating.

code.description: The 7 character Dayton Freight account code.

isBillTo.description: Indicates whether this account is a bill-to account.

name.description: Name of the reference number being provided.

value.description: Additional reference number that correlates to the additional reference name.

Address2.description: The address associated with the account.

AppointmentDetailsModel.description: Indicates appointment details. Required, if accessorials.codes contain APTP.

version.description: Indicates which minor version of the Bill of Lading spec you are consuming

notifications.description: Optional contact information to receive updates about shipment movements via email and/or SMS messaging.

btAccountNumber.description: Account number for Bill To (not required for physical, but may be needed for digital transmission. Not all carriers require)

btAddressName.description: The name of the company for a given address

btAddressLine1.description: The primary address line for a given address

btAddressLine2.description: The secondary address line for a given address

btCity.description: The city for a given address

btState.description: The two-letter state code for a given address

btZip.description: The 5-digit (or 6-characters for Canada) zip code for a given address

btCountry.description: The country for a given address (CAN, MEX, USA). Protects against overlap in different countries.

btPhoneNumber.description: The phone number for a given address

BillToAddressModel.description: An array to hold bill To addresses

amount.description: Amount to be received for the COD.

currency.description: Currency of COD. Defaults to USD.

terms.description: Payment terms associated with the COD.

customerCheckAcceptable.description: Indicates whether or not a customer check or cash is acceptable.

CashOnDeliveryModel.description: Indicates Cash on delivery details. Required, if accessorials.codes contain COD.

CityStateResponseModel.description: Contains city, state, and zip code information.

lineItemLayout.description: Indicates if the Handling Unit/Line Item relationship is known. If this value is used, each Line Item associated to a Handling Unit is conditionally required to be passed within that Handling Unit's object.

CommodityModel.description: Specifies detailing the commodities being shipped.

ContactModel.description: Contact details. Bill To, Remit To, Customs Broker, Origin, Destination.

ContactModel2.description: Object containing contact details for the customs broker.

type.description: Used to identify a customs broker that is involved in a cross-border freight move. Valid Values: Import or Export.

name.description: Company name associated with the customs broker location.

address1.description: Primary Address line for the customsBroker location.

address2.description: Secondary Address line for the customsBroker location.

city.description: City Name for the customsBroker location.

stateProvince.description: Two letter state/province code for the customsBroker location.

postalCode.description: Postal code for the customsBroker location. It is  5-digit for the United States, 5-digit for Mexico, or 6-character alternating letters and digits (w/o space/hyphen in between 3rd and 4th characters) for Canada.

country.description: Three letter country code for the customsBroker location.

start.description: Start Date with or without time

end.description: End Date with or without time

DateRangeModel.description: Time critical date details. Required when Type contains any value.

start.description: Start Date with or without time

end.description: End Date with or without time

DateRangeModel2.description: Appointment date of the shipment requested to be picked up. Required when accessorials.codes contain APTP.

start.description: Start Date with or without time

end.description: End Date with or without time

DateRangeModel3.description: Appointment date of the shipment requested to be delivered. Required when accessorials.codes contain APTD. Valid Formats: * YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sss

cneeAccountNumber.description: The Account number for a given address

cneeAddressName.description: The name of the company for a given address

cneeAddressLine1.description: The primary address line for a given address

cneeAddressLine2.description: The secondary address line for a given address

cneeCity.description: The city for a given address

cneeState.description: The two-letter state code for a given address

cneeZip.description: The 5-digit (or 6-characters for Canada) zip code for a given address (some systems have spaces in them and CAN can be 7)

cneeCountry.description: The country for a given address (CAN, MEX, USA). Protects against overlap in different countries.

cneePhoneNumber.description: The phone number for a given address

stopsAway.description: Number of stops scheduled prior to this Pickup Starting at 3 stops away

monetaryValue.description: Optional attribute to indicate value of the cargo. Required if accessorials.codes contain FVC.

currency.description: Optional attribute indicates currency of MonetaryValue. Defaults to USD.

FullValueCoverageDetailsModel.description: Indicates full value coverage details. Required, if accessorials.codes contain FVC.

GeoCodeResponseModel.description: Last reported coordinates of the Carrier equipment to make Pickup

stopEta.description: Estimated time of arrival at Pick-up (format ISO-8601)

amount.description: The additional amount this upgrade will cost

length.description: The length of the handling units being described

width.description: The width of the handling units being described

height.description: The height of the handling units being described

unitType.description: The type of the handling units being described

totalLinearFeetofShipment.description: Total Linear feet of the shipment

unitCount.description: The number of handling units being described

totalUnitCount.description: The total number of handling units being described

weight.description: Total weight of hazardous material coveraged by one description.

weightUnit.description: The unit of measurement for weight. Defaults to Pounds

class.description: Class that the hazardous material is catogorized by.

unnaNumber.description: Proper Identification Number (UN or NA) corresponding to the Proper Shipping Name.

properName.description:
Proper shipping name for the hazardous material.
From DOT regulations 172.101

technicalName.description:
Technical name for the hazardous material. Not all hazardous items will have a technical name.
From DOT regulations 172.101

packingGroup.description: Hazmat Packing Group number. Not all hazmat items have a packing group.

contractNumber.description: The contract number with the hazardous materials contact.

description.description: Description of the freight being described.

weight.description: otal weight for the specified lineItem.

weightUnit.description:
The unit of measurement for weight. Defaults to Pounds (Imperial) if not passed.

Valid Values: Pounds or Kilograms

pieces.description: Number of individual pieces for the line item being described.

packagingType.description: Packaging type for the individual pieces of the line item being described.

classification.description: Classification of the line item being described.

nmfc.description: NMFC code of the freight being described.

nmfcSub.description: The Sub value for the NMFC of the freight being described.

hazardous.description: Identifies whether or not the freight being described contains hazardous materials.

hazardousDescription.description: Required when 'hazardous' is 'true'. Provides a detailed description of the hazardous item.

tareWeight.description: Weight of the skids/pallets/slips used in the shipment.

weight.description: Total weight for the specified handling units.

weightUnit.description:
The unit of measurement for weight. Defaults to Pounds (Imperial) if not passed.
Valid Values: Pounds or Kilograms

length.description: The length of the handling units

width.description: The width of the handling units

height.description: The height of the handling units

dimensionsUnit.description: The unit of measurement for dimensions.

stackable.description:
Identifies whether or not the freight being described can be stacked on one another.
Default is false.

lineItems.description: Line Item of the handling units.

name.description: Contact person's full name for hazardous related issues.

phone.description: Contact person's phone number for hazardous related issues.

HazardousDetailModel.description: Indicates Hazardous details. Required, if accessorials.codes contain HAZ and/or any commodity line item's hazardous flag set to true.

bol.description: The bill of lading information rendered to a base64 encoded PDF file.

shippingLabels.description: The shipping labels rendered to a base64 encoded PDF file.

ImageResponseModel2.description: Response model that contains the PDF rendered bill of lading and label images if requested.

addresses.description: Provide one or more email addresses to receive the bol and/or shipping labels PDF

includeBol.description: Used to request the bill of lading PDF to be sent to one or more email addresses

includeLabels.description: Used to request the shipping labels PDF to be sent to one or more email addresses. Default is false.

ImagesEmailModel.description: A model for specifying email addresses to receive the PDF image of the bill of lading and/or shipping labels.

includeBol.description: Indicates whether or not you want an image of the populated BOL returned in the response.

includeShippingLabels.description: Indicates whether or not you want image(s) of the shipping labels returned in the response.

requestedPickupDate.description: The intended Ship Date. Note-this does not serve as a Pickup Request.

function.description: The intent for the submitted request.

isTest.description: Indicates whether the submitted request is intended to be a test or not.

requestorRole.description: Identifies the party making the request.

specialInstructions.description: Special delivery instructions that need to be followed for the shipment's delivery.

origin.description: Indicates limited access type. Required when accessorials.codes contain LTDAP.

destination.description: Indicates limited access type. Required when accessorials.codes contain LTDAD.

LimitedAccessTypeModel.description: Indicates the limited access type. Required, if accessorials.codes contain LTDAP or LTDAD.

pieces.description: Optional attribute indicates number of pieces requiring marking or tagging in a shipment. Required, if accessorials.codes contain MARK.

MarkDetailsModel.description: Indicates mark details. Required, if accessorial.codes MARK.

status.description:
Indicates response detail status:
PASS - Request is successful with no exceptions.
FAIL - Request is unsuccessful due to some exception.
WARNING - Request is successful with some caveat.

resolution.description: Provides guidance pertaining to the response code

information.description: Used to provide additional information if needed.

status.description:
Indicates response detail status:
PASS - Request is successful with no exceptions.
FAIL - Request is unsuccessful due to some exception.
WARNING - Request is successful with some caveat.

resolution.description: Provides guidance pertaining to the response code

information.description: Used to provide additional information if needed.

MessageStatusResponseModel2.description: Response model for displaying the outcome of the request.

email.description: Email address number of contact for updates about shipment movements

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of contact for updates about shipment movements

NullableOfPickupStatus.description: Current status of Pickup per the carrier's system (Accepted, Rescheduled, En Route, Arrived, Departed, Cancelled)

terms.description: Freight Billing Terms for the shipment. Available options: PREPAID, COLLECT, THIRD PARTY.

PaymentModel.description: Specifies the payment terms of the bill of lading.

orgAccountNumber.description: Account number for Bill To (not required for physical, but may be needed for digital transmission. Not all carriers require)

orgAddressName.description: The name of the company for a given address

orgAddressLine1.description: The primary address line for a given address

orgAddressLine2.description: The secondary address line for a given address

orgCity.description: The city for a given address

orgState.description: The two-letter state code for a given address

orgZip.description: The 5-digit (or 6-characters for Canada) zip code for a given address (expand to allow 10 characters, zip + 4, some systems have spaces in them and CAN can be 7)

orgCountry.description: The country for a given address (CAN, MEX, USA). Protects against overlap in different countries.

orgPhoneNumber.description: The phone number for a given address. It must follow regex pattern ^(?:([0-9])[-.â—\s]?)?\(?([0-9]{3})\)?[-.â—\s]?([0-9]{3})[-.â—\s]?([0-9]{4})$

isTest.description: Indicates if this is a test request.

pickupAddress.description: The pickup addresses of the pickup request. Only one address is allowed.

grossPickupWeight.description: The Gross pickup weight of all shipments/BOLs on pickup request.

weightUofM.description: The unit of measure for the weight.

handlingUnitCount.description: Total handling units across all BOLs on PU Request

cubicFeet.description: The total cubic feet of the shipment

linearFeet.description: The total linear feet required for the pickup

loadedBy.description: Loaded by either shipper or driver

readyDate.description: Date entire pickup request is ready. Required for Create and optional for Update pickup(format ISO-8601- Ex: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss).

readyTime.description: Time entire pickup request is ready(format ISO-8601- Ex: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss). Time the freight is ready, earliest time the driver can show up

closeTime.description: Time shipper location closes. Required for Create and optional for Update pickup(format ISO-8601- Ex: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss). Time the shipper closes, latest time the driver can show up.

dockContactPhone.description: Shipping department contact phone. It must follow regex pattern ^(?:([0-9])[-.â—\s]?)?\(?([0-9]{3})\)?[-.â—\s]?([0-9]{3})[-.â—\s]?([0-9]{4})$

confirmationEmail.description: Address to email pickup response to (in addition to API accept/reject/etc)

shipmentDetails.description: The information about what's being pickup. Each detail line corresponds to a single shipment/BOL to this pickup. More than 48 detail lines are not allowed (it is the max amount of skid spots that fit on a trailer).

destinationAddress.description: An array to hold destination addresses. More than one address is not allowed

carrierPickupNumber.description: Carrier's pickup number. It must not exceed 25 characters.

shipperRef.description: Returning ref # from request, including Pro #

carrierPickupNumber.description: Carrier's pickup number (One pickup # for each pickup create)

pickupMessage.description: Array of strings for informational or error messages

trailerNumber.description: Confirming trailer # that will be picked up for drop & hook shippers

carrierName.description: Carrier name the pickup request is sent to (Shipper needs to know carrier, especially on the shop floor)

pieces.description: Total pieces associated with the Purchase Order

weight.description: Total weight associated with the Purchase Order

weightUnit.description: The unit of measurement for weight. Defaults to Pounds.

palletized.description: Indicates whether or not the pieces associated with the purchase order are on a pallet/slip/skid or not.

additionalShipperInfo.description: Additional information from shipper per line item

amount.description: Indicates the fee associated with the accessorial (in US dollars).

code.description: The Dayton Freight code identifying the accessorial.

rate.description: The rate of the deficit weight.

amount.description: The total charges for deficit weight.

length.description: The length of the handling unit in inches.

width.description: The width of the handling unit in inches. If the width exceeds the length, the values will be swapped to ensure accurate volume calculation and verification. Width greater than 49 inches will be rounded up to 98 inches for calculating volumetric space on the trailer.

height.description: The height of the handling unit in inches. Height greater than 49 inches will be rounded up to 98 inches for calculating volumetric space on the trailer. If handling unit is marked as non-stackable then the height will be rounded up to 98 inches.

RateHandlingUnitDimensionsRequestModel.description: Specifies the dimesions of this handling unit.

quantity.description: The count of how many copies of this handling unit there are.

stackable.description: Indicates whether this handling unit can be stacked under or on other freight.

quantity.description: The count of how many copies of this handling unit there are.

length.description: The length of the handling unit in inches.

width.description: The width of the handling unit in inches. If the width exceeds the length, the values will be swapped to ensure accurate volume calculation and verification. Width greater than 49 inches will be rounded up to 98 inches for calculating volumetric space on the trailer.

height.description: The height of the handling unit in inches. Height greater than 49 inches will be rounded up to 98 inches for calculating volumetric space on the trailer. If handling unit is marked as non-stackable then the height will be rounded up to 98 inches.

stackable.description: Indicates whether this handling unit can be stacked under or on other freight.

class.description: The freight class of the shipment item.

weight.description: The total weight of the shipment item.

class.description: The freight class of the shipment item.

rate.description: The rate per 100 lbs. The result of the rate will be zero in the case of a minimum charge.

weight.description: The total weight of the shipment item.

hasServiceRestriction.description: A flag that indicates if the rate has service restrictions.

items.description: The list of objects that contains the rate item information.

shipmentDate.description: The date/time of the shipment date.

upgradeOptions.description: The list of Guaranteed Service upgrade Options for this rate

warnings.description: A list of warnings that were generated based on the service parameters requested. Service may be impacted.

accessorials.description: A list of objects that contains the accessorial rate information.

RateMovementType.description:
Represents different rate movement types.
  • Direct - Originating carrier is in control of a shipment for the entire transit time.
  • Partner - Shipment is handed off to a designated partner carrier during transit.
  • Indirect - Shipment is handed off to a different carrier during transit.

originZip.description: The origin/shipper postal code. It is 5-digit for the United States, 5-digit for Mexico, or in the ANA NAN or ANANAN format where A represents a letter and N represents a number for Canada.

destinationZip.description: The destination/consignee postal code. It is 5-digit for the United States, 5-digit for Mexico, or (6 or 7)-character alternating letters and digits with or without space or hyphen for Canada.

directOnly.description:
Specifies whether the rate request should return only direct carrier rates. DirectOnly defaults to false.
  • true - Only return rates where Dayton Freight is the originating carrier and remains in control of the shipment for the entire transit.
  • false - Return all available rates, including:
    • Indirect - Shipment is handed off to a different carrier during transit.
    • Partner - Shipment is handed off to a designated partner carrier during transit.

shipmentDate.description: The shipment date for the rate.

account.description: Alphanumeric Dayton Freight customer code in which to obtain the rate estimate for. In order to request a rate the authenticated user will be required to have access to this customer code.

accessorials.description: A list of accessorial charges. Not all accessorial codes that might be returned on a rate request can be requested. Please see Shipping > Accessorials for DFL Pickup Requests and Rate Requests. Guaranteed Service is not requested as an accessorial and should be requested using the serviceOptions element.

handlingUnits.description: An optional list of handling units that make up the rate request. The handling units can optionally be tied to specific items on the rate request.

items.description:
The list of items to rate.
For rating, items with the same class will be combined to a total weight per class.
Classes used on multiple handling units will be rated individually by handling unit.
There is maximum of 11 rated items per request.

skids.description: The number of skids to use in pallet rates.

RateServiceOptions.description: Dayton Freight provides multiple levels of guaranteed service. The AM Guaranteed Service ensures delivery before noon and the PM Guaranteed Service delivers by 5 PM. If no Guaranteed Services are requested, the response will contain upgrade options if available for the lane. If a Guaranteed Service is requested and is not available, "The (AM/PM) guaranteed service was requested, but is not available for the requested zip codes." error will be returned. To prevent any validation errors, itâ€™s recommended to confirm the available service options before requesting a rate. For more details on guaranteed service, visit https://daytonfreight.com/guaranteed-service/ .

RateTerms.description: The payment terms defines the party responsible for paying the freight charges. Generally the shipper is in charge or paying the charges for prepaid shipments and the consignee for collect shipments. If a shipment involves a third-party the third-party will usually be responsible for the freight charges. Since shippers and consignees could have different pricing structures the terms must be specified when making rate estimate requests.

RateTerms2.description: Payment terms specify which party is responsible for covering invoice charges. For prepaid shipments, the shipper typically pays the charges, while for collect shipments, the consignee is generally responsible. In cases involving a third party, that third party is usually liable for the freight charges. Because shippers and consignees may have different pricing structures, it is important to define the payment terms when submitting rate estimate requests.

refPieceCount.description: The number of pieces associated with the reference number (typically used for PO numbers)

referenceNumber.description: The reference number for the shipment

referenceType.description: The type of the reference number provided (BOL, CPH, DO, LOAD, Master BOL, Order, PO, TMC)

pro.description: Shipper's pre-assigned PRO number for the requested carrier. If one was not provided in the request, one will be auto assigned by the carrier.

shipmentConfirmationNumber.description: It is the ID number provided by the carrier to acknowledge they accepted the BOL and is used in the Bill Of Lading Update Request as the ID.

ReferenceNumberResponseModel.description: Response model that contains the reference numbers that were generated for the bill of lading.

quoteId.description: Rate Number provided after submitting the rate quote request.

shipmentId.description: Shipment Id (SID) number for the shipment.

masterBol.description: Master Bill of Lading number for the shipment.

trailerId.description: Indicates that the shipment is associated to a specific, spotted trailer.

manifestId.description: Indicates that the shipment is associated to a manifest that includes multiple shipments, possibly across multiple spotted trailers.

ReferenceNumbersModel.description: For providing various reference numbers on the bill of lading.

name.description: Name of the remit to company.

address1.description: Primary Address line of the remit to company.

address2.description: Secondary Address line of the remit to company.

city.description: City Name of the remit to company.

stateProvince.description: Two-letter state/province code of the remit to company.

postalCode.description: Postal code for the remit to company location. It is 5-digit for the United States, 5-digit for Mexico, or 6-character alternating letters and digits (w/o space/hyphen in between 3rd and 4th characters) for Canada.

country.description: Three-letter country code of the remit to company.

RemitToModel.description: RemitTo Details. Required, if accessorials.codes contain COD.

RequestFunction.description: Indicates is it a NewPickup, ModifyExisting

ServiceOptions.description: Dayton Freight provides multiple levels of guaranteed service. The AM Guaranteed Service ensures delivery before noon and the PM Guaranteed Service delivers by 5 PM. If no Guaranteed Services are requested, the response will contain upgrade options if available for the lane. If a Guaranteed Service is requested and is not available, "The (AM/PM) guaranteed service was requested, but is not available for the requested zip codes." error will be returned. To prevent any validation errors, itâ€™s recommended to confirm the available service options before requesting a rate. For more details on guaranteed service, visit https://daytonfreight.com/guaranteed-service/ .

shipperRef.description: Shipper reference number for individual shipment - load #, shipment #, etc. Can also be pro

pro.description: The pro number for the shipment

crossRefPro.description: Cross reference PRO number provided by eBOL API

deliveryBeginDate.description: The date (with or without time) the shipment requested to be delivered. (format ISO-8601)

deliveryDateType.description: The type of delivery date requested (Deliver On or After Date, Deliver By Date, Delivery Window, Required Delivery Date)

deliveryEndDate.description: The end date (with or without time) used when a "Delivery Window" type is requested. (format ISO-8601)

descriptionDetails.description: Hold details on the types of freight being shipped.

additionalShipperInfo.description: Additional information about shipper per line item

description.description: The description of the freight included in the shipment

hazmatCheck.description: A flag used to identify whether the freight described is hazardous materials.

individualPieceType.description: The unit type for the individual pieces of the described freight (BAG, BALE, BDL, BOX, BSKD, CAN, CASE, CRT, CTN, DRUM, LSE, OTH, PAIL, REEL, ROLL, SKID, TOTE, WSKD)

individualPieces.description: The number of individual pieces included in the handling unit for the described freight

nmfc.description: The NMFC code for the described freight

nmfcSub.description: The sub value for the NMFC of the described freight

weight.description: The weight (in pounds) of the described freight. It must be between 1 to 40,000.

grossShipmentWeight.description: Gross/total weight (in pounds) of the described freight

netShipmentWeight.description: The net weight (in pounds) of the shipment

handlingUnitCount.description: The handling unit count for the shipment. It must be between 1 to 999.

handlingUnitDetails.description: This array is used to hold additional details about handling units

handlingUnitType.description: The type of the handling units being described

hazmatContactName.description: The name of who should be contacted in the case of a hazardous materials-related issue

hazmatContactPhoneNumber.description: The phone number for the hazardous materials contact

hazmatContractNumber.description: The contract number with the hazardous materials contact

shipmentServices.description: An array to hold the list of services requested (accessorial codes or LTL services)

specialInstructionsDelivery.description: Special delivery instructions that need to be followed for the shipment

specialInstructionsPickup.description: Special pickup instructions that need to be followed for the shipment

referenceNumbers.description: This array is used to supply reference numbers for the shipment

destinationPostalCode.description: Consignee Postal Code (The 5-digit or 9-digit (or 6-characters for Canada) zip code for a given address.)

handlingUnitQuantity.description: Number of Handling Units per Pickup request

serviceCode.description: The code used to represent the service requested (accessorial codes or LTL services)

serviceDescription.description: Desceription for the service (default description will be used if not provided)

cube.description: Cubic volume of the entire shipment (total length X total width X total height).

CubeDimensionsUnit.description:
The unit of measurement for cubic dimensions. Defaults to Feet (Imperial) if not passed. Valid Values: Feet or Meters.
Dayton Freight will convert volume sent in meters to feet.

currency.description: Currency of the declaredValue. Defaults to USD.

declaredValue.description: Total monetary value of the shipment in USD (sometimes needed for cross-border moves).

dimensionsUnit.description:
The unit of measurement for dimensions. Defaults to Inches (Imperial) if not passed. Valid Values: Inches or Centimeters.
Dayton Freight will convert dimensions sent in centimeters to inches.

grossWeight.description: Total weight of the entire shipment, including handling units (tare weight).

handlingUnits.description: Handling unit count for the entire shipment

linearLength.description: Linear length for the entire shipment

netWeight.description: Total weight of the entire shipment, not including handling units (tare weight).

weightUnit.description: The unit of measurement for weight. Defaults to Pounds.

format.description: Specifies the printer format type. Required when images.includeShippingLabels is true. Specifies the printer format type for the labels. Avery: 3-1/3" x 4" (6 labels per sheet) Letter: Standard letter sheet Zebra: 4" x 6" (1 label per sheet)

quantity.description: Specifies the quantity of pages desired. Required when images.includeShippingLabels is true.

position.description: Specifies the starting position. Required when images.shippingLabel is Avery.

ShippingLabelsModel.description: Shipping labels detail. Required when includeShippingLabels is true.

pieces.description: Indicates pieces. Required, if accessorials.codes contain SRT.

SortAndSegregateDetailsModel.description: Indicates sort and segregate details. Required, if accessorials.codes contain SRT.

type.description: Required when accessorials.code list include TCS.

TimeCriticalDetailsModel.description: Indicates time critical details. Required, if accessorials.codes contain TCS.

date.description: The date/time of the shipment date.

transitDays.description: The amount of transit days required.

date.description: The date/time of the shipment date.

transitDays.description: The amount of transit days required.

id.description: Bill of Lading Id. It is the ShipmentConfirmationNumber provided by the carrier, when Bill of Lading got created to acknowledge they accepted the BOL.

version.description: Indicates which minor version of the Bill of Lading spec you are consuming

notifications.description: Optional contact information to receive updates about shipment movements via email and/or SMS messaging.

ApiKey.description: Authorization by x-api-key inside request's header
ApiKey.name: x-api-key
